snippet: More than 10,000 hours of Bob Fass’s radio show, “Radio Unnameable,” were preserved and used by two filmmakers researching a documentary.
abstract: More than 10,000 hours of pioneering free-form radio show Radio Unnameable, which has been hosted by Bob Fass on WBAI radio for over 50 years, are being preserved by filmmakers Paul Lovelace and Jessica Wolfson; pair, who are researching a documentary about Fass, are transferring dozens of boxes of fragile quarter-inch acetate tapes to digital files.
lead_paragraph: More than 10,000 hours of Bob Fass’s radio show, “Radio Unnameable,” were preserved and used by two filmmakers researching a documentary.

headline.seo: Recordings Provide Background for Documentary of Free-Form Radio Pioneer
headline.main: Recordings Preserve the Voices From a Pioneering Free-Form Radio Show
headline.print_headline: Recordings Preserve the Voices From a Pioneering Free-Form Radio Show
